p: Bolivian HF (BHF) (Machupo virus) was identified after several outbreaks of BHF in 1963 in the Beni province of Bolivia. Although BHF incidence increases late during the rainy season, small outbreaks are a dominant feature of the epidemiological pattern with several years of dormancy thereafter. The natural host Calomys callosus invades houses during floods of the rainy season resulting in close contact and human infection (Kilgore etÂ al. 1997).
